alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:09PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Brown, Kewaunee, southern Door, Calumet, northeastern Winnebago, central Waupaca, southern Oconto, Outagamie, eastern Shawano and Manitowoc Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1009 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from Iola to Green Bay, then across the Fox Valley to Brillion and Cleveland. The thunderstorms were moving to the east northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 mph and torrential rainfall can be expected with the stronger storms. HAZARD...Winds in excess oThis strong thunderstorm will be near... Pulaski around 1015 PM CDT. Green Bay and Bellevue Town around 1030 PM CDT. Bay Shore Park around 1055 PM CDT. Luxemburg around 1100 PM CDT.f 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations that will be impacted by the storms include Green Bay, Appleton, Manitowoc, Kewaunee, Algoma, Northport, Curran, Wayside, Gregorville, Rankin, Rose Lawn, Freedom, Newtonberg, Howard and St John. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Winnebago
